alert.note: Alert for Cass (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 24 at 10:11AM CDT until May 31 at 11:30AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Dakota... Sheyenne River Diversion at West Fargo affecting Cass County. Sheyenne River near Kindred affecting Richland and Cass Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Red River of the North at Pembina affecting Kittson and Pembina Counties. Red River of the North at Drayton affecting Marshall, Kittson, Walsh and Pembina Counties. Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Cass and Clay Counties. Red River of the North at East Grand Forks affecting Polk and Grand Forks Counties. Red River of the North at Oslo affecting Walsh, Marshall, Polk and Grand Forks Counties. Sheyenne River at Harwood affecting Cass County. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sheyenne River at Harwood. * WHEN...Until late Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 86.0 feet, MODERATE FLOOD. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 87.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 AM CDT Tuesday was 88.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Monday morning and continue falling to 82.3 feet Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 84.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
